title: Ranking the Supports at Worlds
body:
Disclaimer: This is my opinion, not fact. While you may disagree, you should not be saying that I should somehow change my list because my opinion differs from yours. 

1. GorillA (ROX)
2. Mata (RNG)
3. Wolf (SKT)
4. Meiko (EDG)
5. Biofrost (TSM)
6. Wraith (SSG)
7. Road (IMAY)
8. Mithy (G2)
9. Smoothie (C9)
10. Aphromoo (CLG)
11. Swordart (FW)
12. Albis (AHQ)
13. Vander (H2K)
14. Likkrit (ANX)
15. Mikyx (SPY)
16. Jockster (INTZ)

replies.body: How many of those guys are arguably the best players on their team?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wVoEwzMt,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-09-18T07:52:30.311+0000)
>
> How many of those guys are arguably the best players on their team?

None. Supports don't get to be the best player on their team.

> [{quoted}](name=hotarse,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wVoEwzMt,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2016-09-18T13:30:38.423+0000)
>
> None. Supports don't get to be the best player on their team.

Mata was the MVP 2 years ago.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Hopefully  OHminus can respond as this is HIS post but wanted to give my opinions. 
 " Disclaimer: This is my opinion, not fact" - Ohminus ;]
Mata-Swordart-Aphromoo-Mithy-Biofrost

I thought the exact same thing lol

But, I think most people rank Bjergsen #1 Mid NA. Who do you think is better? Jensen?
Meant world my bad hahaha
Ohhhh, that makes much more sense. Yeah, I would say he is S tier in the World. I would peg him at 3rd out of the teams represented at Worlds. Faker and Kuro are generally better.
No , i put him above Kuro ...Behind Faker and maybe/probably Crown too.And seeing as Crown is in their group, it's gonna be an exciting matchup

Maybe I thought of the question from the Riot dude wrong.  I thought it was who was the best player on their respective team,(maybe just for this split) ?

Bjergsen- I love Bjergsen(no homo) but you could tell he was less of a shotcaller and more of a follower on TSM this split opposed to previous splits, so he got to focus more on KDA, being safe, with a much better roster to {{item:1001}}.  
  He also took a back seat to mainly Doublelift  with the (shotcalling-being the main carry etc) and who protects D-Lift?  Biofrost.  

Can we all say what a difference Biofrost 17-1 > Yellowstar 6th seed is ! 

The greatest western rookie of all time so far.  

I will talk more about my reason later, need to go but wanted to give some thoughts while I could.

He is a very good rookie but even then...

With your logic, that means most support would be the best players on their team since a lot of supports are the shotcallers for their teams...

And best player doesn't mean shotcall. For me , best player is the guy that can change the game alone.Let's be honest, if you watch TSM, biofrost might make some sick plays, but bjerg is the one solo killing people, destroying cs and just destroying his opponent.

Is this supposed to be a rhetorical question to make us think of the importance of these players to their teams, or are you disagreeing with his list without specifying what exactly is off? If you're asking for a number, it would be 4.

I would say 3: Mata, Aphromoo, SwordArt. 

Smeb, Faker, Doublelift+Bjergsen, Ambition?, Athena?, Zven+Trick, Jensen+Sneaky, Ziv?, Jankos?, Kira, Wunder?, Revolta

P.S. I did not realize how hard it is to rank individual players within a team until just now :o

Imo GorillA, Mata, Aphro, and Likkrit. 

Hence why I call group A the "support group"

1 MATA 
2 WOLF 
3 GORILLA 
4 MEIKO 
5 SWORDART 
6 MITHY 
7 APHROMOO 
8 VANDER
9 BIOFROST 
10 MIKYX
11 ROAD 
12 WRAITH 
13 SMOOTHIE 
14 ALBIS 
15 LIKKRIT 
16 JOCKSTER
I agree with most everything except Gorilla and Meiko above Wolf, Aphro above Mithy, Wraith above Mikyx and Road. Otherwise, nice rankings!
I almost completely agree with these rankings. I would put Gorilla and Meiko above Wolf. I would also put Biofrost above Vander, and Wraith above Mikyx and Road. Nice rankings!

APhromoo isa fucking god
how is he that low he is defenitley better than biofrost
Ha, let's see.

I would've ranked Aphro higher, personally - he's been suffering due to his team struggling but he still looks quite good despite that. And I think Biofrost is benefiting from the strength of his team and looks way better than he legitimately is. Aside from that, pretty solid list.

Watch rankings by GBM:
http://www.thescoreesports.com/lol/news/10481-ranked-by-mom-gbm-picks-his-top-5-players-at-worlds-in-each-role

> [{quoted}](name=TBakes,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wVoEwzMt,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-09-22T01:56:13.275+0000)
>
> Watch rankings by GBM:
> http://www.thescoreesports.com/lol/news/10481-ranked-by-mom-gbm-picks-his-top-5-players-at-worlds-in-each-role

GBM's rankings were very unexpected except maybe the top 2.

1. Gorilla
2. Mata
3. Meiko
4. Wolf
5. Mithy
6. Biofrost
7. Aphromoo
8. Swordart
9. Wraith
10. Likkrit
11. Road
12. Vander
13. Smoothie
14. Albis
15. Mikyx
16. Jockster
You have somewhat the right idea for the top 5. You seem to think however that the remaining supports from China and Korea are right below them...
Another thing, is that you undervalue Mithy, Aphromoo, Swordart, and Likkrit. If you remove any of these player from their teams, and put in their subs, it would be much more detrimental, than if you removed Wraith and put in CoreJJ. If CoreJJ started, then I would say that almost nothing has changed(No offense to Wraith, he's an excellent support.) and that SSG will still(in all likelihood) emerge from Group D as the second seed.

Yea, Moo is too low.. 

And although he had an amazing split.... I think Bio is too high. Maybe time will prove this list correct.. but IMO we need more proof on Bio. Maybe just swap those two for now.

Bjerg is #1 mid NA. Jensen is fine. Bjerg is better.
